intro: Sideranthus wootonii, commonly known as the scarlet false rocket, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces vibrant red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, often found in rocky or arid environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for drought-tolerant gardens.
